title: Holy Rosary Catholic Church — Full Site with Admin Dashboard

requirements.text: Build a professional single-page landing site for 'Parishudda Japamaala Maatha Devalayamu (Holy Rosary Catholic Church)' in Nellore. The page must be composed of the following sections in order: Navbar, Hero, Announcements Banner, Daily Mass Schedule, Daily Spiritual Message, Prayer Module, Church Media Gallery, Online Donation CTA, Google Map, and Footer.

quotes: Now Get me the the site
Name of the church : Parishudda Japamaala Maatha Devalayamu (Holy Rosary Catholic Church)

acceptanceCriteria: All sections are visible on the landing page in the specified order.
Church name 'Parishudda Japamaala Maatha Devalayamu (Holy Rosary Catholic Church)' appears in the hero and footer.
The page is fully responsive.

requirements.text: Apply a sacred, professional holy visual theme across the entire site. Use deep navy/midnight blue and warm ivory/cream as primary colors. Accent with gold (#D4AF37) for borders, headings, and highlights. Use Playfair Display (serif) for headings and a clean sans-serif for body text. Add a linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(0,0,0,0.7), transparent) overlay on the Hero image. Use gold borders (#D4AF37) on Priest Welcome and Feast Day cards. All sections should slide up as they enter the viewport. The Online Donation button must have a subtle CSS pulse animation.

quotes: MAke sue everything looks great with descent lovely professional holy look
Gradients: Use a linear-gradient(to bottom, rgba(0,0,0,0.7), transparent)
Borders: Use border-golden (hex #D4AF37)
Sections should 'Slide Up' as the user scrolls
The 'Online Donation' button should have a subtle pulse animation

acceptanceCriteria: Gold (#D4AF37) accent color is consistently applied.
Playfair Display font is used for all section headings.
Hero section has a dark gradient overlay ensuring white text is legible.
Scroll-triggered slide-up animations are active on each section.
Donation button visibly pulses.

requirements.text: Implement a scroll-aware Navbar. On load, the Navbar background is transparent. When the user scrolls past 50px, it transitions to a solid deep navy/blue-900 background. Include the church name and navigation links to each page section.

quotes: Navbar.tsx: Uses useEffect to track window scroll position. If window.scrollY > 50, change background from bg-transparent to bg-blue-900.

acceptanceCriteria: Navbar is transparent at the top of the page.
Navbar background becomes solid navy when scrolled > 50px.
Navigation links anchor-scroll to their respective sections.

requirements.text: Create a Daily Mass Schedule section that reads from a local data store (Motoko backend stable variable acting as a JSON-like record). Display a table/card list of mass timings with fields: Day, Time, and Service Type (Mass / Confession / Adoration). Seed with default data: Sunday 6:30 AM Telugu Mass and Sunday 8:30 AM English Mass.

quotes: Mass Schedule — Day, Time, Service Type (Mass/Confession/Adoration)
{ "day": "Sunday", "time": "6:30 AM", "type": "Telugu Mass" }

acceptanceCriteria: Mass schedule is displayed on the landing page.
Default seed data (Sunday 6:30 AM Telugu Mass, Sunday 8:30 AM English Mass) is visible on first load.
Data updates made in the admin panel are reflected on the landing page after saving.

requirements.text: Create a Daily Spiritual Message section that reads from backend state. Display a card with fields: Title, Author (Pope/Priest name), Full Text, and Date. Implement a 'Read More' modal that expands the full message text with an animation when clicked.

quotes: Spiritual Message — Title, Author (Pope/Priest), Full Text, Date.
DailyMessage.tsx: A card that passes the JSON 'long text' into a Framer Motion Modal.

acceptanceCriteria: Spiritual message card is visible on the landing page.
Clicking 'Read More' opens a modal with the full message text.
Modal can be dismissed.

requirements.text: Create a Prayer Module section with a language filter toggle/search input allowing users to switch between Telugu and English prayers. Prayers are stored in backend state and displayed as cards or a list. The filter updates the visible prayers in real time using React state.

quotes: PrayerModule.tsx: Uses a useState hook to filter prayers by language (Telugu/English) based on the search input.

acceptanceCriteria: Language filter (Telugu / English) is visible and functional.
Selecting a language filters the displayed prayers instantly.
At least 2 sample prayers per language are seeded.

requirements.text: Create a Church Media Gallery section that reads from backend state. Display uploaded images and YouTube video embeds with captions in a responsive grid. Images are stored as base64 or URL references; YouTube URLs render as embedded iframes.

quotes: Media Gallery — Image Upload, YouTube URL, Caption.
The ChurchMedia component maps through media.json and renders the image

acceptanceCriteria: Media gallery renders images and YouTube embeds in a responsive grid.
Each item shows its caption.
Content added via admin is reflected in the gallery after saving.

requirements.text: Create an Announcements Banner at the top of the page (below Navbar) that reads from backend state. Display highlight text, event date, and respect an 'Active' toggle — only show the banner when Active is true.

quotes: Announcements — Highlight Text, Event Date, 'Active' Toggle.
announcements: 'Feast of the Holy Rosary starts Oct 7th.'

acceptanceCriteria: Banner is visible only when the Active toggle is enabled in admin.
Banner shows highlight text and event date.
Deactivating the banner in admin hides it on the landing page.

requirements.text: Embed the Google Map for the church location using the shared URL https://share.google/RgB7sMob1CDcBHUIp. Since shared Google links cannot be iframed directly, display a prominent 'View on Google Maps' button/link that opens the URL in a new tab, accompanied by the church address in Nellore.

quotes: Google Map Location : https://share.google/RgB7sMob1CDcBHUIp
its in Nellore

acceptanceCriteria: A map section is present on the landing page.
A clearly labeled button/link opens https://share.google/RgB7sMob1CDcBHUIp in a new tab.
The church location in Nellore is mentioned in the section.

requirements.text: Build a protected Admin Dashboard at the /admin route. Guard it with a login page that checks a hardcoded password: ChurchofHolyRosary@2026. On successful login, set an auth_session value in localStorage. On subsequent visits, if the auth session is valid, skip the login screen. Provide a logout button that clears the session.

quotes: Frontend Auth: The password is hardcoded as requested.
Keep password : ChurchofHolyRosary@2026
if i am not saving it and i log out then if it vanishes then its fine

acceptanceCriteria: Visiting /admin shows a login form if not authenticated.
Entering password 'ChurchofHolyRosary@2026' grants access.
Wrong password shows an error.
Logged-in state persists across tab switches and page refreshes.
Logout button clears the session and redirects to the login screen.

requirements.text: Build the Admin Dashboard with four management modules: (1) Mass Schedule — add/edit/delete entries with Day, Time, Service Type fields; (2) Spiritual Message — form with Title, Author, Full Text, Date fields; (3) Media Gallery — upload images (single file and bulk folder selection), add YouTube URLs, add captions, and manage/delete existing items; (4) Announcements — form with Highlight Text, Event Date, and Active toggle. Each module has a Save button that persists data to Motoko backend state via canister calls.

quotes: The Admin Panel (/admin) is the 'Command Center.'
in the admin login there is option called media gallery , add an enhancement to add direct folder which has images , videos etc
the data is not saving in landing page when admins enters / gives any data

acceptanceCriteria: All four modules are accessible from the admin dashboard.
Clicking Save in any module calls the backend and persists the data.
After saving, the landing page reflects the updated content.
Media Gallery supports single file upload, bulk folder selection (via webkitdirectory), and YouTube URL input.
Existing media items can be deleted from the gallery manager.

requirements.text: Persist unsaved admin form draft state using localStorage so that if the admin switches browser tabs or navigates away without saving, the in-progress form data is still present when they return to the admin panel. Draft state must only be cleared when the admin explicitly logs out or clicks Save successfully.

quotes: i should not get any issue like if i switch to other tabs , the data is vanishing automatically when i am not saving it

acceptanceCriteria: Switching browser tabs and returning to /admin shows all previously entered (unsaved) form data intact.
Refreshing the admin page restores unsaved draft data.
Logging out clears all draft data from localStorage.
Saving successfully also clears the draft for that module.

requirements.text: Implement all backend data storage using Motoko stable variables in the single main actor. Store: massTimings (array of records with day, time, serviceType), spiritualMessage (record with title, author, fullText, date), mediaItems (array of records with type, url/base64, caption), and announcement (record with text, eventDate, active). Expose update and query functions for each data type.

quotes: the data is not saving in landing page when admins enters / gives any data
Admin Actions: When the Admin saves a change, the dashboard sends a request

acceptanceCriteria: All four data types are stored in stable variables and survive canister upgrades.
Query functions return current data for all four types.
Update functions replace/append data and return a success confirmation.
Landing page frontend fetches from these query functions on load.

constraints: Admin password must be exactly: ChurchofHolyRosary@2026
Church name must appear exactly as: Parishudda Japamaala Maatha Devalayamu (Holy Rosary Catholic Church)
Google Maps URL must be: https://share.google/RgB7sMob1CDcBHUIp
Do not use Next.js, Node.js fs module, or any server-side file system — use Motoko backend for all data persistence
Do not use external databases (Supabase, Vercel KV, etc.)
All Motoko logic must remain in a single actor in backend/main.mo
Do not edit any files listed in frontend.immutablePaths
nonGoals: Real-time WebSocket or push notification features
Payment gateway integration for the donation button (button is a CTA/link only)
Server-side rendering or ISR via Next.js (not supported — use React + Motoko)
Deployment to Vercel or DigitalOcean VPS
Email or SMS notification on admin save
